org.apache.flink.streaming.api.datastream

Class BatchedDataStream<OUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.streaming.api.datastream.BatchedDataStream<OUT>
  • Type Parameters:
    OUT - The output type of the BatchedDataStream
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WindowDataStream

    public class BatchedDataStream<OUT>
extends Object
    A BatchedDataStream represents a data stream whose elements are batched together in a sliding batch. operations like reduce(ReduceFunction) or reduceGroup(GroupReduceFunction) are applied for each batch and the batch is slid afterwards.

    • Method Detail

      • groupBy

        public BatchedDataStream<OUT> groupBy(int keyPosition)
        Groups the elements of the BatchedDataStream by the given key position to be used with grouped operators.
        Parameters:
        keyPosition - The position of the field on which the BatchedDataStream will be grouped.
        Returns:
        The transformed BatchedDataStream

      • reduce

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> reduce(ReduceFunction<OUT> reducer)
        Applies a reduce transformation on every sliding batch/window of the data stream. If the data stream is grouped then the reducer is applied on every group of elements sharing the same key. This type of reduce is much faster than reduceGroup since the reduce function can be applied incrementally. The user can also extend the RichReduceFunction to gain access to other features provided by the RichFuntion interface.
        Parameters:
        reducer - The ReduceFunction that will be called for every element of the input values in the batch/window.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • reduceGroup

        public <R> SingleOutputStreamOperator<R,?> reduceGroup(GroupReduceFunction<OUT,R> reducer)
        Applies a reduceGroup transformation on preset batches/windows of the DataStream. The transformation calls a GroupReduceFunction for each batch/window. Each GroupReduceFunction call can return any number of elements including none. The user can also extend RichGroupReduceFunction to gain access to other features provided by the RichFuntion interface.
        Parameters:
        reducer - The GroupReduceFunction that will be called for every batch/window.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • sum

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> sum(int positionToSum)
        Applies an aggregation that sums every sliding batch/window of the data stream at the given position.
        Parameters:
        positionToSum - The position in the data point to sum
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • sum

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> sum()
        Syntactic sugar for sum(0)
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • min

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> min(int positionToMin)
        Applies an aggregation that that gives the minimum of every sliding batch/window of the data stream at the given position.
        Parameters:
        positionToMin - The position in the data point to minimize
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • minBy

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> minBy(int positionToMinBy)
        Applies an aggregation that gives the minimum element of every sliding batch/window of the data stream by the given position. If more elements have the same minimum value the operator returns the first element by default.
        Parameters:
        positionToMinBy - The position in the data point to minimize
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • minBy

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> minBy(int positionToMinBy,
                                               boolean first)
        Applies an aggregation that gives the minimum element of every sliding batch/window of the data stream by the given position. If more elements have the same minimum value the operator returns either the first or last one depending on the parameter setting.
        Parameters:
        positionToMinBy - The position in the data point to minimize
        first - If true, then the operator return the first element with the minimum value, otherwise returns the last
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • min

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> min()
        Syntactic sugar for min(0)
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • max

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> max(int positionToMax)
        Applies an aggregation that gives the maximum of every sliding batch/window of the data stream at the given position.
        Parameters:
        positionToMax - The position in the data point to maximize
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • maxBy

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> maxBy(int positionToMaxBy)
        Applies an aggregation that gives the maximum element of every sliding batch/window of the data stream by the given position. If more elements have the same maximum value the operator returns the first by default.
        Parameters:
        positionToMaxBy - The position in the data point to maximize
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • maxBy

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> maxBy(int positionToMaxBy,
                                               boolean first)
        Applies an aggregation that gives the maximum element of every sliding batch/window of the data stream by the given position. If more elements have the same maximum value the operator returns either the first or last one depending on the parameter setting.
        Parameters:
        positionToMaxBy - The position in the data point to maximize
        first - If true, then the operator return the first element with the maximum value, otherwise returns the last
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.
